div.h2: To Learn. To Lead. To Serve.

div.p:
Our Mission is to provide an outstanding, transformative education to prepare students for success in college, further education and beyond.
Our Vision is to educate the whole student: mind, body, and character. With the city and world as our classroom, we build a school community rich in rigorous academics and daily experiences of discovery.

li.a: 2001Codman Academy Charter Public School was founded in 2001 as a 9-12 school, and was expanded to a K1-12 school in 2013. We were founded to provide a high-quality, rigorous, and transformative education option to Boston area students.
100%100% of our students are accepted to college.

PartnershipsCodman Academy has many partnerships in Boston. Our Upper School is co-located with our founding partner, the Codman Square Health Center. Other partnerships include The Huntington Theatre Company, the Dorchester YMCA, the American Youth Foundation and the Museum of Fine Arts.

EL EducationAligned with EL Education’s core tenets, Codman Academy strives to cultivate a deep sense of curiosity, mastery of subject matter, commitment, character, and confidence in our students. Our scholars are then able to achieve personal success beyond Codman and contribute to building a better world.

We Are CrewStudents are placed in Crews in the Middle and Upper School, and remain in their Crew their whole time at Codman. During Crew students develop relationships, dedicate time to service, and engage in conversations and check-ins related to academic progress and other school-related issues.

SuccessCodman Academy’s success is in the achievements of our students, alumni, and staff. Most recently, our Head of School, Thabiti Brown, was named a Barr Foundation Fellow. Our Humanities Teacher, Sydney Chaffee was the National Teacher of the Year in 2017. Additionally, Codman was awarded a Bronze Medal as one of U.S. News & World Report’s best high schools in 2015.

Social JusticeSocial justice is integral to every aspect of Codman Academy. Through exposure to an expeditionary learning curriculum deeply rooted in social justice, Codman students demonstrate both an awareness of social justice issues and a commitment to give back to the community.
8Our students speak 8 languages at home: English, Spanish, French, Haitian Creole, Cape Verdean Creole, Arabic, Somali, and Igbo.
The ArtsK1-12 arts and theatre classes include Studio Art, Orchestra, Photography, Music Production, Shakespeare and Theatre.

div.p:
